com.ti.debug.engine.scripting

Class Memory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ti.debug.engine.scripting.Memory

  • public class Memory
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encapsulates the memory access methods (save, load, read, write, register access and program load) An instance of this class is automatically created when a new session is opened.

    Note: When specifying file paths during function calls, the slashes need to be represented using '/' or '\\' (with an escape character).

    // Create Environment and open a debug session
    ScriptingEnvironment env = new ScriptingEnvironment();
    DebugServer myServer = (DebugServer) env.getServer("DebugServer.1");
    DebugSession mySession = myServer.openSession("*", "*");

    ...

    // Load a program
    mySession.memory.loadProgram("./debug/myFile.out");

    ...

      • fill

        public void fill(long nAddress,
                 int nPage,
                 int nLength,
                 long nValue)
          throws ScriptingException
        This function fills a block of target memory (specified by start address, page and length) with a specified value.
        Parameters:
        nAddress - is the first address in the block.
        nPage - the memory page. Use one of Memory.Page enumeration.
        nLength - defines the number of words to fill.
        nValue - specifies the value that will be used to fill memory.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • fill

        public void fill(java.lang.String sSectionName,
                 long nValue)
          throws ScriptingException
        This function fills an entire section with a specified value.
        Parameters:
        sSectionName - the name of the section to fill.
        nValue - specifies the value that will be used to fill memory.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • getPage

        public int getPage(int nPage)
        This is a convenience method that will return a valid page number for the current target. In some situations, when using DSS methods that take a Page argument, it may be necessary to write a script that works transparently on targets that support paged memory and targets that do not. This method will count the number of pages of the current target and return page 0 (PROGRAM) if you specify a page that does not exist: int getPage(int nPage) { // Start off by assuming that the page passed-in is valid. int nValidPage = nPage; int pageCountTgt = numberOfMemoryPages(); // Returns 1 for arm and 6000; 5 for 55+ and 3 for everything else if ( nPage > (pageCountTgt - 1)) { nValidPage = Page.PROGRAM; //PROGRAM = 0 } return nValidPage; }
        Parameters:
        nPage - memory page
        Returns:
        A valid memory page for the current target

      • load

        public void load(long nAddress,
                 int nPage,
                 int nLength,
                 java.lang.String sFile)
          throws ScriptingException
        This function loads a block of target memory from a file. If the filename extension is *.out then COFF format is used. Otherwise the header information in the file is used to determine the file format.
        Parameters:
        nAddress - is the first address in the block.
        nPage - the memory page. Use one of Memory.Page enumeration.
        nLength - defines the number of words to fill.
        sFile - specifies the name of the file that will store the target data.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException
        See Also:
        Memory.Page

        public void loadBinaryProgram(java.lang.String sFileName,
                              long startAddr)
                       throws ScriptingException
        Load a binary file onto current target/CPU. A Target.halt() is automatically issued prior to the program load and a Target.restart() is automatically issues after the load is complete.
        Parameters:
        sFileName - the name of the file to load. Relative paths are permitted, use ScripingEnvironment.setCurrentDirectory(String) to change the current working directory.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

        public void loadData2(long nAddress,
                      int nPage,
                      int nLength,
                      java.lang.String sFile)
               throws ScriptingException
        This is an API for loading data in additional formats. This should be used to load files saved with the com.ti.debug.engine.scripting.Memory.saveData2 API.

        nAddress - is the first address in the block.
        nPage - the memory page. Use one of Memory.Page enumeration.
        nLength - defines the number of items
        sFile - specifies the name of the file that will store the target data.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • loadProgram

        public void loadProgram(java.lang.String sFileName)
                 throws ScriptingException
        Load an executable file onto current target/CPU. A Target.halt() is automatically issued prior to the program load and a Target.restart() is automatically issues after the load is complete.
        Parameters:
        sFileName - the name of the file to load. Relative paths are permitted, use ScripingEnvironment.setCurrentDirectory(String) to change the current working directory.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • loadProgram

        public void loadProgram(java.lang.String sFileName,
                        java.lang.Object[] args)
                 throws ScriptingException
        Load an executable file onto current target/CPU and pass an array of arguments to main(). The ARGS data structure is defined according to a convention with linker. In order to be able to pass arguments to main(), it is necessary to use the option "--args=###" when linking your executable. With this option, the linker will allocate a ".args" section starting with ___c_args__, and with this "###" many bytes. The ___c_args__ buffer will be constructed as follows: digraph argsBuffer { rankdir=LR; node [shape=record, width=2]; args [label="<argc> argc | <argv0> argv\[0\] | <argv1> argv\[1\] | <argvetc> ... | <argv3> argv\[n\] | <null> NULL"]; vals [label="<argv0> argv\ 0\ string | <argv1> argv\ 1\ string | <argvetc> ... | <argv3> argv\ n\ string"]; args:argv0 -> vals:argv0; args:argv1 -> vals:argv1; args:argv3 -> vals:argv3; } argc,
        argv[0], --> argv 0 string
        argv[1], --> argv 1 string
        ...,
        argv[n], --> argv n string
        NULL

        If a valid array was passed-in and "--args="###" was not used as a linker option, this method will raise an error. If the .args section is too small to hold the specified arguments the arguments will be written but an error will be logged. A Target.halt() is automatically issued prior to the program load and a Target.restart() is automatically issues after the load is complete.
        Parameters:
        sFileName - the name of the file to load. Relative paths are permitted, use ScripingEnvironment.setCurrentDirectory(String) to change the current working directory.
        args - an Object array of arguments. Each argument will be one element in the array (there is no need to specify an argc value or starting address - this is calculated automatically). When writing to the target, the Java method "toString()" will be called on each argument to build the char* data on the target.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • loadRaw

        public void loadRaw(int nPage,
                    long nAddress,
                    java.lang.String sFilename,
                    int nTypeSize,
                    boolean bByteSwap)
             throws ScriptingException
        Load a raw file from the host to target memory (specified by start address, page and length). Filesize is automatically determined and the entire file is loaded *
        Parameters:
        nAddress - is the first address in the block.
        nPage - the memory page. Use one of Memory.Page enumeration.
        sFilename - specifies the name of the file that will store the target data.
        nTypeSize - specifies the type size of the data. Affects how data is byte-swapped to account for differences in host and target endianess. For example: if the target is big endian (the host is always little endian) and you specify nTypeSize = 16 then the upper and lower bytes are swapped after loading the file - but before writing to target memory.
        bByteSwap - Force a byte-swap of the data before writing to target memory. If Host and Target are difference endianess - this will effectively disable the automatic endianess conversion.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • readData

        public long readData(int nPage,
                     long nAddress,
                     int nTypeSize)
              throws ScriptingException
        Read a single integer value from the target and return the result as an unsigned integer. Specify the bit length of the type to read in nTypeSize.
        Parameters:
        nPage - memory page
        nAddress - start address to read from
        nTypeSize - bit length
        Returns:
        Value read from memory
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • readData

        public long readData(int nPage,
                     long nAddress,
                     int nTypeSize,
                     boolean bSigned)
              throws ScriptingException
        Read a single integer value from the target. Optionally sign-extend the return value. Specify the bit length of the type to read in nTypeSize.
        Parameters:
        nPage - memory page
        nAddress - start address to read from
        nTypeSize - bit length
        bSigned - if true then return value will be a signed integer. If false then return value will be unsigned.
        Returns:
        Value read from memory
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

                       long nAddress,
                       int nNumWords,
                       boolean bSigned)

        Parameters:
        nPage - memory page
        nAddress - start address to read from
        nNumWords - the number of words to read
        bSigned - if true then each element in the returned array will be signed integer. If false then return values will be unsigned
        Returns:
        Array of words read from memory
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • reloadProgram

        public void reloadProgram()
                   throws ScriptingException
        Reload the last-loaded program onto current target/CPU. Any additional symbol-packages loaded since the last program-load will be overwritten. A Target.halt() is automatically issued prior to the program load and a Target.restart() is automatically issues after the load is complete.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • save

        public void save(long nAddress,
                 int nPage,
                 int nLength,
                 java.lang.String sFile,
                 int nIOFormat,
                 boolean bAppend)
          throws ScriptingException
        This function saves a block of target memory (specified by start address, page and length) to a file. If the filename extension is *.out, then COFF format is used. Otherwise, C-Style Hex is used.
        Parameters:
        nAddress - is the first address in the block.
        nPage - the memory page. Use one of Memory.Page enumeration.
        nLength - defines the number of words to fill.
        sFile - specifies the name of the file that will store the target data.
        nIOFormat - specifies the format in which memory words will be written to the output file. Use one of Memory.IOFormat enumeration.
        bAppend - pass true to append to an existing file, false to overwrite. Note: Append is not supported for COFF formatted files.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • saveBinary

        public void saveBinary(long nAddress,
                       int nPage,

                       java.lang.String sFile)
                throws ScriptingException

        nPage - the memory page. Use one of Memory.Page enumeration.
        nLength - defines the number of words to fill.
        sFile - specifies the name of the file that will store the target data.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException
        See Also:
        Memory.Page

      • saveData2

        public void saveData2(long nAddress,
                      int nPage,
                      int nLength,
                      java.lang.String sFile,
                      int format,
                      boolean bAppend)
               throws ScriptingException
        This API supports saving data in additional formats not supported by com.ti.debug.engine.scripting.Memory.saveData() The list of supported formats could be listed using the com.ti.debug.engine.scripting.Memory.getSupportedTypes() API
        Parameters:
        nAddress - is the first address in the block.
        nPage - the memory page. Use one of Memory.Page enumeration.
        nLength - defines the number of items
        sFile - specifies the name of the file that will store the target data.
        format - - desired format
        Throws:
        ScriptingException
        See Also:
        getSupportedTypes(int nPage), saveData2(long nAddress, int nPage, int nLength, String sFile, int format, boolean bAppend)

      • saveRaw

        public void saveRaw(int nPage,
                    long nAddress,
                    java.lang.String sFilename,
                    int nLength,
                    int nTypeSize,
                    boolean bByteSwap)
             throws ScriptingException
        This function saves a block of target memory (specified by start address, page and length) to a raw binary file.
        Parameters:
        nAddress - is the first address in the block.
        nPage - the memory page. Use one of Memory.Page enumeration.
        sFilename - specifies the name of the file that will store the target data.
        nLength - the length in number of target memory words.
        nTypeSize - specifies the type size of the data. Affects how data is byte-swapped to account for differences in host and target endianess. For example: if the target is big endian (the host is always little endian) and you specify nTypeSize = 16 then the upper and lower bytes are swapped after reading the data from memory - but before writing to disk.
        bByteSwap - Force a byte-swap of the data before saving to the file. If Host and Target are difference endianess - this will effectively disable the automatic endianess conversion.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • setBssInitValue

        public void setBssInitValue(java.lang.Long nInitValue)
        Set value to initialize BSS section to. A value of null will cause BSS initialization to be skipped altogether.
        Parameters:
        nInitValue -

        Throws:
        ScriptingException

        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • writeRegister

        public void writeRegister(java.lang.String sRegister,
                          long nValue)
                   throws ScriptingException
        Write a value to a register on the target.
        Parameters:
        sRegister - the name register.
        nValue - the value to write to that register.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

                      long nAddress,
                      long nValue)
               throws ScriptingException

        nPage - memory page
        nAddress - memory address
